Articles.Content:
Squad,

First, thanks for producing such an amazing game! I love it and have lost literally hundreds of hours of my life playing, building, and flying.

I was putting a satellite in orbit today and the music I was listening to ended. I noticed that the quiet humming, rumbling sound was there and it made me think...

1. How about making unmanned spaceships truly silent?

2. Adding some fan/electonic/general ambiance, to crewed ships, similar to what's there now, but perhaps a bit more varied.

3. Finally, I'm sure that spacesuits make interesting sounds, it would be really cool to add those real sounds to EVA.

Thanks again for the fantastic game. I love it. (I've also given it as a gift at least 3 times!)

Cheers!

-Dan

Aesthetics are nice, and with 0.90.0 (I think) scope completion will be reached. So, the devs will have time to spend on the little things that make the game better, and be tweaking like there's no tomorrow.

I fully support the idea of little background noises. Especially some beeps from probes and wheel motors.

However, in the meantime, check this out.

Chatterer Mod

Game audio could use some improvement. Unmanned probes totally silent in a vacuum? Ok, I'll go with that, so long as I can get a indicator of some kind while in the map view to let me know when a stage runs out of fuel. Maybe a fuel light on the navball or something. I'm used to an audio alert of some kind to let me know when a stage runs out of fuel and it's time to press the space bar, which doesn't work all the time anyway. A fuel light would be nice. That way I'm not carrying around spent fuel tanks anymore.
